org.purewidgets.client.widgets
Class GuiTextBox

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              org.purewidgets.client.widgets.GuiWidget
                  org.purewidgets.client.widgets.GuiTextBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
FocusHandler, KeyPressHandler, HasAttachHandlers, EventHandler, HasHandlers, EventListener, HasVisibility, IsRenderable, IsWidget, InputFeedbackListener, InputListener, ReferenceCodeListener
public class GuiTextBox
extends GuiWidget
implements KeyPressHandler, FocusHandler

The TextBox widget shows a graphical textbox with a caption (and reference code) inside.

CSS Style Rules

.instantplaces-GuiTextBox[-disabled]
the outer element. [-disabled] is applied when the textbox is disabled
.instantplaces-GuiTextBox[-disabled] .textbox
the textbox
.instantplaces-GuiTextBox[-disabled] .captioncontainer
the container for the caption and reference code
.instantplaces-guiTextBox[-disabled] .captioncontainer .caption
the label with the caption
.instantplaces-guiTextBox[-disabled] .captioncontainer .referencecode
the label with the reference code
.instantplaces-GuiTextBox[-disabled] caret
the label with the blinking caret

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Description copied from class: GuiWidget
Sets the visual feedback of the widget to enabled or disabled. This settings affects only the visual state. The widget may still receive input even if its visual state indicates otherwise.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class GuiWidget

setInputEnabled

public void setInputEnabled(boolean inputEnabled)
Description copied from class: GuiWidget
Enables or disables this Widget's processing of InputEvents. If disabled, the Widget will no longer fire ActionEvents. Subclasses should obey this rule and call fireActionEvent (which does this checking) to fire ActionEvents to their listeners.

Overrides:
setInputEnabled in class GuiWidget
